page.title: 10INFLUENCE OF PRIVATE CARS
page.content: For centuries this area was isolated by the nature of the terrain and dense woodland and a high proportion of the population would spend their entire lives in the same village, possibly never venturing further than the nearest market town. The coming of the{motor car}and the improved road system have greatly altered this pattern and there are very few members of the indigenous families left. The high prices paid for even the smallest country cottage means that the young people must move out for their first homes, and a great many of the residents, if not retired, commute to Gloucester, Cheltenham, or Hereford daily. Only a very small proportion now work at home or on the land.
